cgb_init_job.py¶

Initialize a cluster containing a GB with particular macroscopic character and minimize the microscopic degrees of freedom according to parameters from the parent Project.

usage: cgb_init_job [-h] [--procs PROCS] [--debug]
                    [--thermo-period THERMO_PERIOD]
                    [--dump-period DUMP_PERIOD]
                    name {macro,rot,copy} ...

Positional Arguments¶

name Unique job name.
gb_style

Possible choices: macro, rot, copy

Define the macroscopic degrees of freedom for the GB.

Named Arguments¶

–procs, -np

Max processors available to run mpi on.

Default: 1

–debug, -dbug

Rename LAMMPS log files so you can see all of them.

Default: False

Output¶

Parameters for output frequency.

–thermo-period, -thermo
 Period for writing thermodynamic output during annealing.
–dump-period, -dump
 Period for dumping xyz positions during annealing. (Default is first and last only.)

Sub-commands:¶

macro¶

Define the GB by providing shared and normal axes along with a misorientation.

cgb_init_job macro [-h] [--misorientation MISORIENTATION]
                   [--shared SHARED SHARED SHARED]
                   [--normal NORMAL NORMAL NORMAL]

Named Arguments¶

–misorientation, -m
 Relative misorientation between two grains in degrees. (Default is random value.)
–shared, -s Shared axis for GB. (Default is random.)
–normal, -n GB plane normal vector for one grain. Should be normal to shared axis. (Default is random.)

rot¶

Define the GB by providing two rotation matrices (row by row, 2*3*3 = 18 elements total). This is the description used by Olmsted, Foiles, and Holm (2009) and many boundaries can be found in their supplementary material.

cgb_init_job rot [-h]
                 rot1 rot1 rot1 rot1 rot1 rot1 rot1 rot1 rot1 rot2 rot2 rot2
                 rot2 rot2 rot2 rot2 rot2 rot2

Positional Arguments¶

rot1 Rotation matrix for the first grain.
rot2 Rotation matrix for the second grain. Must also share one vector with the first rotation matrix

copy¶

Simply copy the Bravais lattice of each grain from another Job.

cgb_init_job copy [-h] job_dir

Positional Arguments¶

job_dir Path to directory where another Job exists
